input_data.title: Uncoupled
input_data.overview: Michael thought his life was perfect until his husband blindsided him by walking out after 17 years. Michael has to confront two nightmares â€” losing his soulmate and suddenly finding himself a single gay man in his mid-40s.

response.analytical_summary: Uncoupled is a comedic soap opera exploring the aftermath of a long-term relationship's unexpected end. The series follows Michael, a New York City real estate broker, as he navigates the challenges of single life and dating in his 40s, grappling with heartbreak, reinvention, and the complexities of modern relationships. With a blend of humor and pathos, the show examines themes of identity, loss, and the search for connection in a rapidly changing social landscape. The series offers a lighthearted yet relatable portrayal of navigating unexpected life changes and finding your way forward.
response.spoiler_rich_plot_summary: The series begins with Michael's world shattering when his partner, Colin, abruptly announces he's leaving after seventeen years together. Michael is forced to confront his sudden single status and the need to rebuild his life and dating prospects in New York City. He leans on his friends, particularly his best friend Carol, for support as he begins to explore the dating scene, encountering a series of awkward and often humorous encounters. Throughout the series, Michael grapples with the reasons behind Colin's departure, leading him to question his own identity and the nature of their relationship. He revisits past relationships and explores new connections, ultimately seeking to understand himself and find a path towards happiness and acceptance. While he experiences setbacks and moments of doubt, Michael gradually begins to embrace his newfound independence and redefine his vision for the future, demonstrating resilience and a willingness to move forward.
response.keyword_sentence: Uncoupled is a comedic soap opera set in modern-day New York City, exploring themes of heartbreak and reinvention as a gay protagonist navigates unexpected loss and searches for connection in the dating scene.
